page.title: 12INTERPRETATION CENTRE
page.content:
From 19 July 1985 the new Les Mielles Interpretation Centre is open to the general public every afternoon.
It aims to help people understand more about their environment, especially Les Mielles, to create a sense of concern for conservation, and also to help people enjoy their visit.
A model of the whole Les Mielles area is at the entrance and around the walls are displays showing the history and development of the area.
The rich plant and animal life are displayed and there will soon be a theatre for visitors to see a 15 min presentation on the area.
The States of Jersey are paying Â£50,000 for this project.
